executive_summary: Over the past five years, business coaching agencies have faced unprecedented volatility. Many downstream companies had to tighten their budgets when the COVID-19 pandemic hit, dragging down revenue for business coaches. Some coaches managed to mitigate losses by shifting their services online, but others weren't able to invest in the necessary platforms quickly enough. Many newly unemployed workers sought business coaching to improve their job prospects, but the size of this market wasn't large enough to offset declining demand from coaches' top clients. Strong economic recovery and mass rehirings brought business coaches revenue growth that more than offset 2020's losses, but recent inflation has forced

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Inflation is straining demand despite business coaching's market acceptance
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Business owners and job seekers have accepted business coaching as a valuable expense for streamlining efficiency and improving employee retention, leading to solid growth over the past two decades. According to Forbes, several large corporations, including Microsoft and AT&T, have invested in training and development to adapt to the evolving business landscape and contemporary social issues. However, clients to cut spending on business coaching services again. Revenue has slumped at a CAGR of 0.3% to an estimated $14.1 billion over the five years through 2024, when revenue will dip 0.4.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Business Coaches Saw Heavy Volatility Through The Pandemic
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Still, intense inflation has forced downstream businesses to contend with rising purchasing costs in the latter half of the current period. Corporate profit has been sinking in the latter half of the period, pushing many clients to reconsider their expenses. Business coaching has taken a backseat to more essential purchases amid shrinking budgets, slowing business coaches' revenue growth. The onset of the COVID-19 pandemic sent revenue into a freefall for businesses in many industries, forcing would-be clients to tighten budgets. These companies cut back on discretionary spending and laid off workers, significantly dragging down revenue for business coaching agencies.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Competition Is Heating Up, Both Internally And Externally
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Competition among business coaches has become much more fierce. Low barriers to entry have enabled a steady stream of new coaches to join the industry and compete for clients. Rising saturation has escalated price competition, forcing many coaching agencies to drop their rates and absorb

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Online Courses Continue to Temper Profit Losses
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Online courses have become exceedingly prevalent in the industry. Managers, entrepreneurs and executives are the top clients for business coaches, and these individuals' busy schedules make the flexibility of online coaching programs very attractive to them. Online courses have significantly cut the industry's reliance on labor. Prerecorded lectures are much cheaper for business coaches, and online meetings on platforms like Zoom have helped coaches assist more clients in a day. Still, prerecorded lectures don't replicate the experience of in-person coaching. Seminars aren't tailored to the client's specific needs and wants, so only renowned coaches with established track records can charge moderate prices for them.

Highly reputable business coaches have fared better in this increasingly crowded market. College and university courses and degree programs compete with business coaching services, covering comparable content and providing valuable degrees. Business coaches are gaining a leg up on these competitors as student loan debt balloons, pushing students toward shorter, cheaper programs outside a four-year university. Business coaches have been under intensifying pressure from in-house training programs. Giant corporations are increasingly relying on their own training and development departments because of their better internal knowledge and understanding of the company.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: EMPLOYMENT TRENDS HAVE SWAYED OUT OF THE INDUSTRY'S FAVOR
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Unemployment is set to spike in 2024 after years of solid job growth as corporate profit remains subdued and high interest rates continue to deter investment. A spike in unemployment will cut demand for business coaching by shrinking workforce sizes and reducing the benefits of group professional development services. Business coaching's high value to jobless workers will help temper losses by spurring demand from those looking to pad their resume and improve their job prospects. Still, entrepreneurs and individuals account for a minor share of industry revenue. A drop in business from managers and team leaders weighed heavier than demand from this demographic could offset.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: WANING INFLATION WILL MAKE ROOM FOR REVENUE GROWTH TO RETURN
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The Federal Reserve is expected to begin lowering interest rates in late 2024 and 2025, indicating settling inflation. Lowering rates will renew investment activity from businesses, which also will make them more willing to spend on business coaching services. As inflation settles, consumers will benefit from rising disposable income and will be able to spend more on discretionary services. Expanded budgets will help business coaches capture demand from individuals looking to improve their skillsets. This economic uptick will push corporate profit upwards, giving potential business clients room in their budgets to hire coaching services and train their managers, team leaders and executives.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: MARKETS ARE SET TO EXPAND FOR BUSINESS COACHES
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Both the number of employees and the number of businesses in the US are expected to climb through the next period, indicating an expanding market for business coaches.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Successful Business Coaches Will Cater to Their Clients' Needs
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As these new businesses crowd existing markets, new and old companies will face intensifying competition. Business coaches provide training that helps clients streamline efficiency and avoid losing profit, so the industry is set to enjoy revenue growth through the end of 2029. A decline in the national unemployment rate will translate to expanding workforces in many industries. These larger teams will seek business coaching programs to help train new hires. Tailoring courses and schedules to suit individual clients will give business coaching providers an advantage. Self-paced programs are expected to become more popular because of the flexibility it affords busy executives and managers.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Coaches Will Seek to Gain Visibility Through Marketing
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Advertising is becoming essential to differentiate in the busy business coaching industry. Platforms like TikTok and Instagram allow connection with customers through authentic, real-life stories. Balancing advertising costs with impactful results will remain critical for success as the number of business coaches continues to climb. Price competition between coaches will intensify as new entrants emerge, so business coaches that lose clients to cheaper competitors will face declining

industry_definition: This industry includes companies that offer short-duration courses and seminars for management and professional development. Business coaches provide customizable training courses to the general public or employers looking to improve their workforce's skills. These training sessions can be conducted at a coaching agency's training facilities, at a client's workplace or remotely through TV or the Internet.

negative_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: low - decreasing

key_trends: Business coaches with successful track records are the most valuable. Most clients of this industry are in higher-level positions, typically seeking a high-quality educational service with a short duration.
Colleges and universities offer courses that rival what business coaches can provide. Business coaches must differentiate themselves from these courses through their expertise, value and flexibility.
Revenue will return to growth as inflation slows in the coming years. Corporate profit will rise accordingly, making business coaching services more affordable to the industry's top clients.

Business coaches continue to navigate unprecedented challenges. While a strong economic recovery helped coaches recover from pandemic revenue losses, inflation and rising labor costs threaten the industry's ability to gain revenue in 2024.

Interpublic is a public company headquartered in New York with an estimated 55,600 employees. This company holds a significant market share in at least six industries, the largest being the Media Buying Agencies industry.
There are very few major companies. Barriers to entry are very low, so new coaching agencies and nonemployers regularly open and drag down concentration.

The International Coach Federation (ICF) internally regulates the industry. The ICF's code of ethics and professional standards help business coaches establish credibility, and business coaches rely on their reputation to attract clients.

The International Association for Continuing Education and Training (IACET) gives clients peace of mind. While accreditation isn't legally required, clients are much more likely to hire an accredited business coach.
Profit has taken a hit as wages climb. Lackluster revenue growth amid inflation has compounded with significant salary hikes to dampen profit for business coaches.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Managers and team leaders are the top clients for business coaches. These clients seek opportunities to enhance their strategic business management skills by learning the leadership techniques and supervisory abilities necessary for efficient operations.

CEOs, CFOs and COOs often hire business coaches to enhance their strategic thinking and crisis management. These coaches help executives tackle specific issues with their businesses or uncover blind spots. Business coaches' services to executives are similar but distinct from the Management Consulting industry's services.

This segment includes entrepreneurs and business owners. Entrepreneurs are known for their knack for innovative risk-taking, laying the foundation for fresh ventures. Business owners look after well-established entities, prioritizing stability, growth and possession.

General staff members, teachers, students and individuals also seek quality assurance or compliance training within specific industries to improve their job performance. Clients in this segment usually have their training paid for by their employer.

products_and_services.product_description: Business coaches offer professional development courses involving seminars and courses on topics like finance and accounting, communication and interpersonal skills, marketing and time management.
Business coaches provide courses and individual training sessions that help clients learn new skills and become more educated in fields like business, marketing and economics.

This segment's courses include seminars on strategic business management, leadership, management and supervisory skills, sales management and IT management. It also includes literacy programs, GED, second-language and special educational programs, higher academic courses, vocational programs and specialized training programs focused on subjects like physical, life, computer and information sciences.

Book, Magazine & Newspaper Wholesaling in the US
Internet Service Providers in the US

tier_2_suppliers: Computer Peripheral Manufacturing in the US

Office Stationery Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Many of the industry's clients are multinational corporations, so demand for business coaches is susceptible to changes in corporate spending. Clients are less inclined to invest in business coaching when corporate profit drops, while strong profit encourages spending on employee training and development.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast is home to over a quarter of the nation's population, creating a large workforce and high demand for business coaching. Large metropolitan areas like Miami and Atlanta are home to numerous corporations. These businesses rely on coaches to help develop their workforces and give them a strategic advantage.

California, the nation's most populous state, is by far the top state for business coaching. An active tech sector in Silicon Valley and other booming industries in the state creates a need for business training.

Some of the largest cities in the country, like New York City and Philadelphia, are located in the Mid-Atlantic. These cities have large financial corporations that seek training and courses to keep their employees and leaders equipped to handle their duties. The Mid-Atlantic's dense population pushes job seekers in this region to complete several courses in their field to stand out among thousands of other applicants.
The Great Lakes region has a significant population where business coaching services are crucial for navigating employment trends.
The Southwest contains a growing array of industries that require professional development services.
The Rocky Mountains region has various establishments seeking business coaching services.
New England has a historical basis for education and business services that supports the coaching industry.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The US Department of Labor issues licenses and administers federal labor laws to guarantee workers' rights to fair, safe and healthy working conditions, including minimum hourly wage and overtime pay, protection against employment discrimination and unemployment insurance.
Health and safety guidelines were established in 2020 amid COVID-19. These guidelines advised temporary social distancing and ongoing additional sanitation measures within facilities.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry is in the growth life cycle stage.
The capital intensity level is low for the industry.
The market concentration level is low in the industry.
The globalization level is low but increasing for the industry.

basis_points.basis_description: Business coaches with successful track records are the most valuable.
Most clients seek high-quality educational services with short durations.
Coaches with access to wealthier clients can charge higher prices.

concentration_points.concentration_description: There are seven times more nonemployers than employers in the industry.
Demand for business coaching is localized, favoring local providers.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wage costs comprise wages for business coaches and teaching, administration and management staff. Coaching is immensely labor-intensive, making wages the industry's top expense.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Small Costs Add Up for Business Coaches
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Business coaching can be expensive as it involves expenses for outsourced professional services, like legal and accounting consultancy.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: While business coaches have few capital expenses, labor costs can be significant. Wages are by far the industry's top expense.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Business Coaches Are Vulnerable To Macroeconomic Swings
volatility_points.volatility_description: As a highly discretionary service, business coaching revenue is typically unstable as it largely relies on companies' discretion and variable budgets for employee training.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Most Companies and Independent Professionals Recognize the Benefits of Business Coaching
volatility_points.volatility_description: Changes in the labor market can also influence demand for business coaching.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Online Coaching Platforms Are Giving Clients Flexibility
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Developing an online coaching platform enables better pre- and post-training support and networking, which enables companies in this industry to establish an ongoing relationship with their clients.

FAQs.question: What were the COVID-19 mandates for this industry?
FAQs.answer: Health and safety guidelines were established in 2020 amid COVID-19.

FAQs.question: What is the role of the International Coach Federation (ICF)?
FAQs.answer: The ICF is a nonprofit organization that self-regulates the industry by maintaining a code of ethics and professional standards for business coaches.

FAQs.question: What is the role of the International Accreditors for Continuing Education and Training (IACET)?
FAQs.answer: IACET is a nonprofit organization that accredits business coaches.

FAQs.question: Has the demographic breakdown of the client base changed as the population has aged?
FAQs.answer: Although the population has aged, older workers are less likely to seek out business coaching.

FAQs.question: Is there a strong reputation among customers? Is reliability and performance known?
FAQs.answer: The perceived value of a company is important for the recruitment of new clients for seminars and workshops.
